0.Pros: Worked with a lot of cool people.
0.Cons: Not the most fun work, but easy.

1.Pros: -Great CoworkersI love all of my coworkers including all of the managers, you get to be pretty good friends with people-Learn people skills.This might not apply if you work anywhere other than cashier or drive-thru, but I've found that I've become a lot more of a people person after having to interact with 100s a day.-Advancement opportunitiesMany of the higher-ups in my location only took a handful of months to go from crew member to trainer, and then only a year or so to go from that to shift manager. If you don't burn out and stay on for a few years, it's virtually guaranteed you can become a manager
1.Cons: -McUnderstaffedWe don't have enough people, period (location specific)-McTerriblewagesI get paid a wage that in my area would be less thank half of the poverty line yearly-McUnflexiblehoursGod help you if you have something you HAVE to do during one of your scheduled days.

3.Pros: Gives you job experience and some spending cash

4.Pros: Blast to work with fun people

5.Pros: flexible hours, guaranteed 30 hrs a week minimum, employee discount
5.Cons: questionable ethics, improper training, mismanaged franchise, impossible standards, supervisors believe in screaming and belittling you rather than explanation and talking, expects you to put the job before family

6.Pros: not really any almost no benefits

7.Pros: Crew is fun to work with on slow days but that is about it.
7.Cons: No raises in over a year no appreciation for the work. No one in upper management cares unless your numbers are good.

9.Pros: Everyone is nice at McDonald's I like the people that work with me most of the time
9.Cons: Managers can be very rude and inconsiderate at McDonald's about others with disabilities
